description: The Lesnes Estate, part of the Thamesmead 'town of tomorrow', is at threat of demolition, resulting in the dispossession of the diverse and vibrant working-class community that call the estate their home. Join housing campaigners and residents to celebrate the estate, go on tours of the area, and hear from speakers about the process of estate regeneration, and its impact on communities.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes: Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email about any changes to the programme that might affect your visit.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Contructed between 1967-1975, Thamesmead Estate was designed as a new town on Thames estuary marshland by the Greater London Council.

images.title: Campaigners and residents at the estate, April 2024.

travel_info: Additional travel info: From Abbey Wood Station: Past Sainsbury's, down Lensbury Way and it will be on your left.

name: The Lesnes Estate - And the campaign to save it
